properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 15 at 8:18PM PST until January 16 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford OR
properties.description:
...Heavy precip brings lower elevation snow tonight...

.Storm reports and ODOT cameras are suggesting snow levels are
crashing down to 1500 feet under some heavy precipitation this
evening. Snow will likely continue to accumulate around 1500 feet
tonight under the heavy precipitation. The one exception will be
around the Rogue Valley where we are still expecting snow levels
around 2000 feet.

* WHAT...Snow expected above 1500 feet. Total snow accumulations
of 5 to 10 inches. Winds gusting as high as 65 mph.

* WHERE...Northern central Siskiyou County. This includes
portions of Interstate 5 north of the Shasta Valley toward
Siskiyou Summit. It also includes the city of Hilt.

* WHEN...From 4 PM Wednesday to 4 PM PST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Travel will become difficult. The hazardous
conditions could impact morning or evening travel.

* View the hazard area in detail at
https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD
properties.instruction:
* Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination.

* Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and
limited visibilities.

* See https://www.tripcheck.com or http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for
latest road conditions.

* A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow
will cause travel difficulties.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THURSDAY ABOVE 1500 FEET
